ConformanceCriteria.Description: The system MUST provide a link that a user can select to initiate an SSO transaction.
ConformanceCriteria.Name: SSO Link Provided

ConformanceCriteria.Description: The system MUST implement a mechanism through which it can discover the user's IDP system. There are two options for this: communicate with an available centralized IDP Discovery Service, or implement a local IDP Discovery Service. For example, the system can implement local IDP discovery by providing the user with a series of links through which to select an IDP.
ConformanceCriteria.Name: Support for IDP Discovery

ConformanceCriteria.Description: Upon user selection of an IDP, the system MUST generate a SAML AuthnRequest and send it to the selected IDP.
ConformanceCriteria.Name: Authn Request Following IDP Discovery

Artifacts.Description: Provide the URL of the system's website page that includes an SSO link, or provide a screenshot of the page if the URL is not publicly available.
Artifacts.Name: SSO Link

AssessmentSteps.Description: Does the system provide a link that the user can select to initiate an SSO transaction?
AssessmentSteps.Name: SSO Link Provided

Artifacts.Description: Provide screenshots and/or an explanation of how the system supports IDP discovery (e.g., local mechanism, centralized service, dynamic/automatic discovery, etc.)
Artifacts.Name: Discovery Details

AssessmentSteps.Description: Does the system provide a mechanism for handling IDP discovery?
AssessmentSteps.Name: Support for IDP Discovery

Artifacts.Description: Provide a header trace including the AuthnRequest generated by the system.
Artifacts.Name: SAML AuthnRequest Artifact

AssessmentSteps.Description: Upon selection of an IDP from the single sign-on page, does the system send a SAML AuthnRequest to the selected IDP?
AssessmentSteps.Name: Authn Request Following IDP Discovery

Metadata.Description: The SAFECOM/NCSWIC user interface requirements for implementing a SAML Service Provider.
Metadata.Name: SAML SP Requirements - User Interface - Complex Issuance

Terms.Definition: Refers to a comprehensive approach for dealing with digital identities (and associated attributes), credentials, and access control within a federated environment (across jurisdictional boundaries).
Terms.Name: Federated Identity, Credential, and Access Management

Terms.Definition: The National Council of Statewide Interoperability Coordinators (NCSWIC) promotes and coordinates activities designed to ensure the highest level of public safety communications across the United States.
Terms.Name: National Council of State-Wide Interoperability Coordinators

Terms.Definition: Alternate term for a service provider.
Terms.Name: Relying Party

Terms.Definition: Established in 2001 as a Presidential E-Government Initiative, SAFECOM is a mission-guided and stakeholder-supported public safety communications program of the United States Department of Homeland Security.
Terms.Name: SAFECOM

Terms.Definition: A set of eXtensible Markup Language (XML) data structures and messaging protocols designed to enable single sign-on between system entities.
Terms.Name: Security Assertion Markup Language

Terms.Definition: A system that provides a user with some service capability, requently within Federated ICAM implementations. A service provider is the Federated ICAM counterpart to an identity provider.
Terms.Name: Service Provider

Terms.Definition: The means by which the user and a computer system interact, in particular through the use of input devices and software.
Terms.Name: User Interface
